author: {'steamid': '76561198166686532', 'num_games_owned': 1419, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1707388546}
review: Это сугубо виртуальный проект. Представляет собой нечто вроде раннера от первого лица, где вы несётесь на некой платформе вперёд с бешеной скоростью, и пытаетесь увернуться от надвигающихся плит. Это игра настоящий вызов для вашей реакции и заставит попотеть. Так что, если у вас слабый вестибулярный аппарат и вас быстро укачивает, то это не для вас. Легко потерять ориентацию и равновесие, и врезаться в настоящую стену, а не в виртуальную).

author: {'steamid': '76561198066590240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2800, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1576561847}
review:
Warning:  this game should be called Extreme Workout VR.  Because that is exactly what it is.  Geez, I only played 8 minutes and I'm already all sweaty and tired.  You have to move quickly either to the left, right or middle.  And you have to constantly squat down to avoid the obstacles (basically move to the opening in the wall, the rest of the wall being the obstacle).  You're supposed to be collecting balls while doing the above.  

The coaster is just a big room scale area (get as much roomscale as you can) and that'll be where you can move to quickly avoid the obstacles.  There's easy, normal, and hard levels.  However, the only difference that I noticed was that you could press trigger more often to activate the slow motion ("bullet time") mode, where time slows down and you can more easily get to the correct spot.  There's also a comfortable option and it just made your view smaller and things blurrier (IMO).  Good thing I don't ever suffer from VR nausea.

However, even on easy this game is quite the workout.  So I don't recommend this game unless you're willing to play 2 minutes a a time or you are in good shape.  And just forget about it you're completely out of shape.  

Rating 7/10 game should be called [b]Extreme Workout VR or you'll hit the wall (roomscale edition)[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198110583459', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1502597849}
review: Juego simple, que podría ser interesante, pero que no cuida nada la jugabilidad. Hay que esquivar físicamente los obstáculos, pero en cuanto chocamos con uno, hay que volver a empezar desde el principio. Se hace cansado (físicamente) y extremadamente tedioso el volver a empezar cada vez, incluso en modo sencillo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298025584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1488443873}
review:
跑酷是一种街头艺术，因为它自由度颇高，又不受场地的局限，逐渐演变成年轻人所喜爱的极限运动。随着跑酷运动的风靡，这一类型的玩法也被引用到游戏当中，通过《神庙逃亡》、《地铁跑酷》等优秀作品逐渐被大众所熟知。
　　不过近几年跑酷游戏的脚步似乎已经驻足不前了，尽管不断有新游戏推出，但玩法依旧千篇一律，过了新鲜劲的玩家们就不再买账了。而虚拟现实技术的兴起似乎又让跑酷游戏重新回到了人们的视野。
　　不久前我们体验到一款名为《过山车（Roomscale Coaster）》的动作游戏，游戏的动作性完全超乎我们的想象。下面就一起来看看这款游戏的特别之处。
　　《过山车（Roomscale Coaster）》是一款动作跑酷游戏。玩家在游戏中乘坐穿越山脊之间的轨道车，通过自己的肢体动作来躲避途中的障碍物，并收集沿路的能量球获得分数。
　　一个叫过山车的跑酷游戏
　　看游戏名的时候完全不觉得这游戏会有什么乐趣，无非就是个过山车的体验游戏吧，但游戏的宣传视频却勾起了我们的好奇心，想看看这到底是款什么样的游戏。
　　游戏的场景建模很广阔，环顾四周是一片一望无际的山丘，山脊间寸草不生，看起来一片荒芜。游戏没有新手教程，上来就直接选择难度然后开始游戏，不明所以的情况下在第一个障碍上就栽了跟头。
　　体验过后，完全有种被游戏名给忽悠的感觉，原本以为无非是体验下过山车的速度感也就无关痛痒了，没想到游戏一上来就给玩家一记暴击。
　　游戏单纯只是借了过山车的名号，虽然场景道具确实是过山车的配置，玩法却是跑酷。游戏基本没让玩家闲着，全程都是在上蹿下跳的动作中度过的，玩个游戏基本就是在做全身运动了，不出十分钟铁定满头大汗。
　　《过山车》的动作性与难度算是目前我们体验过诸多VR跑酷游戏中最高度。游戏玩法与《立体脆VR战斗》有异曲同工之妙，玩法操作基本一致，不过后者的难度较低，虽然动作性也很强，但难度却不及《过山车》的二分之一，主要还是趣味性比较强。
　　游戏分为简单、普通和困难三种模式，除了困难模式的视觉范围有些许限制以外，就是些许速度上的差异，其余的玩法并没有多大的不同。但就算是最简单的模式我们也跑不出太高的分数，游戏的难度实在有点非人类了。
　　难度较大
　　游戏的主要难度就在于速度。以往的跑酷游戏，多半初始速度较慢，过程中再逐渐加速。而《过山车》却反其道而行之，不但初始速度极快，过程中还会时不时的提速，只能通过收集能量球来换取那一两秒可怜的减速。但即便是这样，在高速行进又要躲闪障碍物的情况下，完全来不及分心去抓能量球，这样的设定不是坑爹吗。
　　说这款游戏坑爹绝对不假，但欲罢不能也是真心，人不都是这样越有挑战性就越有胜负欲。游戏对玩家肢体协调以及反应能力的要求不是一般的大，不同于《神庙逃亡》这种只需要靠手眼协调反应的手机游戏，即便是速度再快，以手指的灵活度还是应付得来的，可能也是因人而异，但一般人在神庙中都不会出门没多久就“死掉”吧。
　　然而《过山车》就是这么一个奇葩的游戏，一出门就加速的设定让我们在前两个障碍上就频频失误，好不容易熟悉了游戏节奏，时不时突然来个加速，又反应不过来撞死了。而我们通常又对这种虐身又虐心的游戏特别来劲，感觉不征服它简直浑身不爽。
　　作为跑酷游戏，一般都是以分数为评定标准的吧，然而游戏在评分标准上又搞了一出叫人吐血的设定。游戏在分数评定上又不按常理出牌，通常跑酷游戏都是以所跑路程的长短在加上道具金币来统计分数的吧，然而《过山车》并不计算你跑出去的长度，而是只以你抓到的能量球为计分标准，这又将游戏的难度提高了一个层次。
　　本来游戏的速度就够变态了，还在分数上这么下功夫，简直就是不想让玩家拿到高分。上文我们也提到了游戏过程中完全应接不暇的动作反应，最后好不容易跑了一大段，回头发现分数少的可怜也是备受打击。
　　游戏基本所有的机制都与正常的跑酷游戏背道而驰，把玩家虐了千万遍之后，却仍然吸引着我们不断挑战，这或许就是改变带来的不同。玩惯了普通的游戏之后，一个机制完全相反的游戏反而更能吸引我们。
　　缺乏竞争性
　　说完《过山车》特立独行的游戏机制所带来的惊喜，我们还要说说它的不足之处。玩过跑酷游戏的玩家们应该都知道，游戏中多半都是会有排行的设定，能够激发玩家的好胜心，彼此竞争之下也能够带动游戏的参与度。
　　而游戏难度如此高的《过山车》却没有设计一个玩家排行的机制。虽然游戏本身的难度就够挑战玩家的好胜心了，但终究没有个对比，所谓有对比才有进步，不知道自己跟别人的差距，单纯只是挑战游戏的难度也难免会有无聊的时候。
　　所以游戏缺乏一个刺激玩家进步的动力，游戏反人类的难度终究会导致玩家放弃游戏，若是能有玩家之间的竞争，会让游戏更加有趣些。
　　除此之外，游戏还存在一些BUG。游戏的选择项不好操作，反应不够灵敏，幸好此类操作都是在选择项上，并未对游戏造成困扰。另一个问题就比较严重，游戏常在进行中突然闪退，此类情况还不止一次，影响游戏心情，希望官网尽早修复这些BUG。
　　总结
　　游戏的整体体验效果极佳，丰富的肢体运动让游戏十分带感。尽管《过山车》的玩法单一到极致，就那么一个场景一直重复变化，但加上了超强的动作性以及VR的临场感，还有那反人类的难度，简直一玩就上瘾。
　　目前《过山车（Roomscale Coaster）》在steam上的售价为13元。游戏特别适合喜欢运动的玩家体验，大幅度的动作操作对空间要求还是蛮大的，玩家们在玩之前最好先准备个大一点的场地，方便大展身手，不过游戏还存在一些BUG，影响游戏体验。由于游戏难度较高，所以不适合单纯享受游戏乐趣的玩家，推荐喜欢挑战高难度的玩家们购买体验。
http://www.83830.com/game/201703/113235480_1.shtml

author: {'steamid': '76561197966649882', 'num_games_owned': 2002, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1489110348}
review:
[h1]Roomscale Coaster - [i]Lose weight and your balance dodging platforms in VR ![/i][/h1]

This is an exercise game, you move along a track at breakneck speed and dodge floating platforms, guaranteed to make you sweat!

[b]ROOMSCALE / ENVIRONMENT[/b] 
The mountain that serves as the games back drop is very nice, but you will not be looking at that...youll be looking at the large platforms flying towards you at massive speed, these are not so nice and do not feel in keeping with the aesthetic of the mountain, at first thought i was thinking wood beams etc would look nicer but the platforms stand out a lot and that may of been what the dev was trying to do. But yeah the environment while not great is adequate for this type of game.

[b]GRAPHICS[/b] 
Passable, not bad, just not amazing, again though with this type of game it is not really the graphics that sell it.

[b]PERFORMANCE[/b] 
Amazingly fast, i mean i was moving (or felt like i was) at 100mph and there was no frame rate issues at all, performance was spot on.

[b]INTUITIVENESS[/b] 
Apart from a start button placed in such a way that you are facing the wrong way at first (you soon orientate yourself correctly) it was pretty intuitive, the game concept is straightforward….duck and weave or die lol.

[b]PROS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] Really good for exercise.
[*] Very reasonably priced (about the price of a good coffee).
[*] More fun than it really should be.
[/list]

[b]CONS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] If you suffer vr motion sickness then this is not the game for you.
[*] Very hard.
[*] Very easy to lose your balance or trip on the cable (in fact my test session ended when i jumped back and hit my head on a real wall dodging a virtual one (haptic feedback who needs it!)...i am going to have a lump there that is for sure!)
[/list]

[b]VERDICT[/b] 

If you are looking for a cheap exercise game, you are not prone to vr sickness and you have the good sense to not head butt a wall, then this is worth picking up. That said it is a close call, it may be the concussion starting to set in but i really had to think if to say yes or no to recommending the game and it was only the price that sealed the deal, it is worth the price of a coffee. Now i really need to go and find some ice for the back of my head (could have been worse i could have smacked the vive on the wall, i mean that is pricey to repair, however my head will grow back...right?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198127316121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1488510615}
review: WOW!!!  Great game and what an extremely hell of a vr ride!!  Simple mechanics and great visuals.  Only one thing I would like to request from the Devs is to add instructions on the menu on what or how the game is played.  It took me a few tries to figure it out but overall a fun game!  Try easy mode first just incase you get the motion sickness issue.  Once you get the hang of it you will like it alot and dare yourself for a faster ride...

author: {'steamid': '76561198355316388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1488492509}
review: Good game :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198029982617', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1494781455}
review:
I was drawn in by the visuals, and I can confirm that the map itself is breathtaking in VR. The track however looks a little out of place and kind of breaks the aesthetics, but it’s not a huge issue as your senses will be pretty occupied with the obstacles ahead. 

Thanks to the power of VR you’re in for a extreme ride. The platform you’re standing on moves fast, and you have to move really quickly in all directions within your playspace in order not to smack into the walls ahead. 

Roomscale coaster is the game to play if want to improve your stamina and ducking abilities. It’s simply an excellent workout game that might also give you an adrenalin rush. 

[i]I played without the comfort option and didn’t feel any nausea, but then again I think my VR feet are pretty much fully grown by now.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198054131489', 'num_games_owned': 786, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1488402911}
review: If you want to make use of your room-scale and jump around dodging obstacles like a Ninja, this game is for you. I was falling over and still had a huge smile on my face. It's going to be my new favourite exercise game alongside Climbey VR. Definitely, definitely, worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011629292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1494702072}
review:
Well well well... Roomscale Coaster....

If you'd like to become a [i]ninja[/i] with sick reflexes and some awesome moves – this game is for you!! 
It reminds me a lot of the show – “Hole in the Wall”, but it’s just more about collecting balls for points, and just dodge everything like a ninja. And when I say ninja…. I mean Jackie Chan skills… If you, (Like me), was so excited to get into the game and read nothing of the text that helps you get started – you completely don’t know you can slow down time…. So, I have felled over, hit stuff in my room, and jumped into a wall, all this to just have fun in the game! :D 
It’s really addicting, you just need to make sure you have a lot of space… AND REMEMBER YOUR ABILITY!! - If not you will fail hard.. – unless you are as good a ninja as I am ;)

[list]
    [*]Fun
    [*]Addicting
    [*]But make sure you have enough space to really move around!
[/list]

 I Recommend this to others – especially at the low price of 4$/4€

author: {'steamid': '76561198042666823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1488393235}
review:
This is a physical game where you get to move your body like spiderman does, so you really do need your roomscale!

My right buttock hurts like hell after I lost my balance and fell backwards. Be careful!! :D

BTW, motion sickness is pretty much guaranteed...
